abstract.title: GNOME 2.14
abstract.para: GNOME 2.14 is the latest version of the GNOME Desktop; a popular, multi-platform desktop environment for Linux, UNIX and other platforms that is both free and open software. GNOME comprises of both a desktop and developer's platform and provides all of the common tools computer users have come to expect of a modern computing environment, as well as a flexible and powerful paltform for software developers.

The GNOME Desktop is released every six months and delivers new features, improvements, "bug" fixes and translations with every new release. GNOME 2.14 is no different and includes many interesting new features and XXX-FIXME hundred bugfixes. To learn more about GNOME and the qualities that distinguishes it from other computer desktop environments (like usability, accessibility, internationalisation and freedom) visit the About GNOME page on our website.

The GNOME 2.14 release contains all of the applications needed to provide basic user functionality including system menus, file management, web browsing and email. It also includes lots of common accessories like a calculator, dictionary, document reader, image viewer, multimedia player, text editor and UNIX terminal emulator. Through its excellent developer platform, many other excellent free and open source applications are also available including Abiword, a fully featured word processor; Gnumeric, a powerful spreadsheeting application; the GNU Image Manipulation Program, a popular image editor similar to Photoshop; and Inkscape, a flexible vector graphics application. You can find out about these and other great GNOME applications from the website GNOMEfiles.org.
GNOME 2.14 includes all of the improvements made in GNOME 2.12 and earlier. You can learn more about GNOME 2.12 from its release notes.
GNOME is part of the GNU Project. GNOME is proud to both be and support free software.
